header.name: header
header.description: Additional headers to send to server for introspectionQuery

key.name: key
key.description: The API key for the Apollo Engine service

engine.name: engine
engine.description: Reporting URL for a custom Apollo Engine deployment

frontend.name: frontend
frontend.description: URL for a custom Apollo Engine frontend

clientReferenceId.name: clientReferenceId
clientReferenceId.description: Reference id for the client which will match ids from client traces, will use clientName if not provided

clientName.name: clientName
clientName.description: Name of the client that the queries will be attached to

clientVersion.name: clientVersion
clientVersion.description: The version of the client that the queries will be attached to

tag.name: tag
tag.description: The published tag to check this client against

queries.name: queries
queries.description: Deprecated in favor of the includes flag

includes.name: includes
includes.description: Glob of files to search for GraphQL operations

excludes.name: excludes
excludes.description: Glob of files to exclude for GraphQL operations. Caveat: this doesn't currently work in watch mode

tagName.name: tagName
tagName.description: Name of the template literal tag used to identify template literals containing GraphQL queries in Javascript/Typescript code

client:codegen.description: Generate static types for GraphQL queries. Can use the published schema in Apollo Engine or a downloaded schema.

config.name: config
config.description: Path to your Apollo config file

header.name: header
header.description: Additional headers to send to server for introspectionQuery

key.name: key
key.description: The API key for the Apollo Engine service

engine.name: engine
engine.description: Reporting URL for a custom Apollo Engine deployment

frontend.name: frontend
frontend.description: URL for a custom Apollo Engine frontend

clientReferenceId.name: clientReferenceId
clientReferenceId.description: Reference id for the client which will match ids from client traces, will use clientName if not provided

clientName.name: clientName
clientName.description: Name of the client that the queries will be attached to

clientVersion.name: clientVersion
clientVersion.description: The version of the client that the queries will be attached to

tag.name: tag
tag.description: The published service tag for this client

queries.name: queries
queries.description: Deprecated in favor of the includes flag

includes.name: includes
includes.description: Glob of files to search for GraphQL operations

excludes.name: excludes
excludes.description: Glob of files to exclude for GraphQL operations. Caveat: this doesn't currently work in watch mode

tagName.name: tagName
tagName.description: Name of the template literal tag used to identify template literals containing GraphQL queries in Javascript/Typescript code

watch.name: watch
watch.description: Watch for file changes and reload codegen

target.name: target
target.description: Type of code generator to use (swift | typescript | flow | scala), inferred from output

localSchemaFile.name: localSchemaFile
localSchemaFile.description: Path to your local GraphQL schema file (introspection result or SDL)

addTypename.name: addTypename
addTypename.description: [default: true] Automatically add __typename to your queries, can be unset with --no-addTypename

passthroughCustomScalars.name: passthroughCustomScalars
passthroughCustomScalars.description: Use your own types for custom scalars

customScalarsPrefix.name: customScalarsPrefix
customScalarsPrefix.description: Include a prefix when using provided types for custom scalars

mergeInFieldsFromFragmentSpreads.name: mergeInFieldsFromFragmentSpreads
mergeInFieldsFromFragmentSpreads.description: Merge fragment fields onto its enclosing type

namespace.name: namespace
namespace.description: The namespace to emit generated code into.

operationIdsPath.name: operationIdsPath
operationIdsPath.description: Path to an operation id JSON map file. If specified, also stores the operation ids (hashes) as properties on operation types [currently Swift-only]

only.name: only
only.description: Parse all input files, but only output generated code for the specified file [Swift only]

useFlowExactObjects.name: useFlowExactObjects
useFlowExactObjects.description: Use Flow exact objects for generated types [flow only]

useFlowReadOnlyTypes.name: useFlowReadOnlyTypes
useFlowReadOnlyTypes.description: Use Flow read only types for generated types [flow only]

outputFlat.name: outputFlat
outputFlat.description: By default, TypeScript/Flow will put each generated file in a directory next to its source file using the value of the "output" as the directory name. Set "outputFlat" to put all generated files in the directory relative to the current working directory defined by "output".

globalTypesFile.name: globalTypesFile
globalTypesFile.description: By default, TypeScript will put a file named "globalTypes.ts" inside the "output" directory. Set "globalTypesFile" to specify a different path.

args.name: output
args.description:
Directory to which generated files will be written.
- For TypeScript/Flow generators, this specifies a directory relative to each source file by default.
- For TypeScript/Flow generators with the "outputFlat" flag is set, and for the Swift generator, this specifies a file or directory (absolute or relative to the current working directory) to which:
  - a file will be written for each query (if "output" is a directory)
  - all generated types will be written
- For all other types, this defines a file (absolute or relative to the current working directory) to which all generated types are written.
